function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Potential risk of undetected sars-cov-2 in wastewater due to limitations in concentration and detection methods.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of optimization for the entire protocol from sampling to detection/quantification may lead to inaccurate results and inefficient virus analysis.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Significant issues identified for the virus quantitative analysis in wastewater and sludge matrices, indicating potential challenges in accurate virus detection and quantification in these complex environments.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Utilization of advanced rna detection methods like crispr and dpcr for virus detection and quantification presents the risk of misinterpretation or inadequate understanding of the results compared to traditional methods like rt-qpcr.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex microfluidic systems with interconnected networks may be prone to contamination and spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Low-cost mass production of loc-based devices may lead to compromised quality control and increased risk of device malfunction.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Widespread use of loc-based techniques for viral detection may create false positives or false negatives in diagnostic results.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Development of lab-in-a-tube, lab-in-a-box, and lab on-a-drone systems for disease diagnosis","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid development and deployment of poct systems for pandemic diagnosis","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global emphasis on the need for rapid and sensitive detection techniques like biosensors","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of influenza a h1n1 and human adenovirus","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Potential spread of sars-cov-2","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limited understanding of biosensor terminology among environmental audience","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High lods for lassa fever, west nile fever, and influenza could lead to missed detection of the viruses in wastewater, increasing the risk of environmental contamination.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Absence of a paper-based device to detect sars-cov-2 in wastewaters increases the risk of undetected viral presence in the environment and potential transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complex matrix in wastewaters may interfere with biosensor detection, leading to inaccurate results and potential misinterpretation of viral presence.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Endogenous biomarkers present in sewage systems can be used to estimate the real-time population served by the system, posing a risk of privacy invasion.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"The identification and monitoring of disease biomarkers in sewage systems could lead to the unintentional disclosure of health information of entire populations.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Proteomic identification of disease biomarkers in sewage systems may lead to the unintentional tracking and monitoring of health conditions of different populations, potentially violating privacy and ethical standards.","category":"Data Privacy and Security risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Reliance on pcr for detection of sars-cov-2 in wastewater","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of standardized evaluation and verification of rt-qpcr methods","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complexity of wastewater matrix impacting detection methods","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Discrepancies between laboratories due to factors such as qpcr platforms, pcr inhibitors, nucleic acid extraction efficiency, and low levels of targets","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Large uncertainty in viral load in feces making it difficult to determine a typical value for wbe and comparison with clinical data","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of standardization in laboratory protocols for detecting sars-cov-2 and determining viral content","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate adaptation of clinical technology to wbe","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Small market size for environmental biosensors","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of optimization in wastewater treatment technology for virus transmission control","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of pcr technologies and endogenous biomarker measurements may lead to inaccurate identification of specific diseases.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate identification of specific diseases due to biomarkers not being specific to a given disease, leading to misdiagnosis and ineffective containment measures.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Detection of asymptomatic cases and immunized patients through wbe may lead to complacency and reduced adherence to preventive measures.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of microfluidic cartridges and pcr-based systems for rapid testing","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Approval and widespread use of various poct systems","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Application of technology without professional skills","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Global environmental changes such as climate change and ecosystem shifts altering the thresholds of the planet","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of the complex ways in which global changes affect human, animal, and natural systems","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Continued high incidence and distribution of vectorborne diseases vbds","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Vector-borne diseases and zoonotic diseases are implicated, disproportionately impacting people in tropical climates with inadequate access to health services, poor housing, weak governance structures, and socio-economic underdevelopment.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uneven distribution of progress in tackling vector-borne diseases vbds across the world and across all diseases.","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Emerging vector-borne diseases, such as zika virus zikv and chikungunya chik , have infected millions and are linked to neurological and developmental disorders in infants.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Over-emphasis on technology and biomedical expertise","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Underdeveloped thematic areas for vbds: community participation, citizen engagement, social differentiation, and wider system dynamics","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for vulnerability, resilience, adaption, and community-based approaches","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased vector densities and geographical spread due to climate change","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of understanding the impacts of global change on vector-borne diseases","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate community-based approaches for vector-borne disease strategies","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Wide variation in level of detail provided in adaptation plans","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of attention to education and community participation","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Failure to specify responsible agencies and mechanisms for collaboration and funding","category":"Political risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Vector-borne diseases transmitted by multiple species of vectors","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"}]}
